subject: p11880923
History: -year-old man with recent desaturation despite intubation.
Findings: Endotracheal tube, nasogastric tube, right hemodialysis catheter and right-sided surgical drain are in unchanged position with interval removal of left-sided Swan with sheath still within the left internal jugular vein. Asymmetric right greater than left pulmonary edema and moderate pleural effusion are unchanged with progressive right sided volume loss and rightward shift of the mediastinum over the past films. The heart size is top normal in size with normal cardiomediastinal contours.
Impression: Progressive right sided volume loss since intubation could be due to mucous plugging iwith unchanged right effusion and vascular congestion. Findings discussed with Dr. By Dr. At on by phone.
